pullRequest.title: Add Collection of Comp Sci Bibliographies fetcher
pullRequest.bodyText:
Fixes #6638

 Change in CHANGELOG.md described (if applicable)
 Tests created for changes (if applicable)
 Manually tested changed features in running JabRef (always required)
 Screenshots added in PR description (for UI changes)
 Checked documentation: Is the information available and up to date? If not created an issue at https://github.com/JabRef/user-documentation/issues or, even better, submitted a pull request to the documentation repository.

commit.message: Add Collection of Comp Sci Bibliographies fetcher

nodes.bodyText:
I like links; thus, I added one

  
    
      
        Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            - We added a new fetcher to enable users to search "Collection of Computer Science Bibliographies". [#6638](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/6638)
          
          
            
            - We added a new fetcher to enable users to search "[Collection of Computer Science Bibliographies](https://liinwww.ira.uka.de/bibliography/index.html)". [#6638](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/6638)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -11,6 +11,7 @@ Note that this project **does not** adhere to [Semantic Versioning](http://semve
 
 ### Added
 
+- We added a new fetcher to enable users to search "Collection of Computer Science Bibliographies". [#6638](https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/issues/6638)

nodes.bodyText: Please add an empty line before

Can XMLUtil print to a log file?
Then one could use LOGGER.debug(...)
The current solution is also OK for me.
Note that toString() in the BibTeX class does not produce "valid" BibTeX in all cases - see the method comment there. - However, in this case, it is fine.

Not sure whether this should be closed, too.
I think, however, that closing the inputStream is enough. (Which surely happens somehwere in the code)

This reminds me of DublinCore. We have support for Dublin Core somehwere in JabRef.
With checking for dc:title, the parser will fail if the XML namespace prefix changes to dc2 or something other than dc.
I think, for the current PR, it's OK. For a future PR, I would be very happy if you digged into the Dublin Core thing.
This is a task where the patience is requested. Deep thinking what's better. Starting point: #938 (comment)

Could you please use our BibEntry build thingy, here`
bibEntry2 = new BibEntry()
  .withField(...)
  .withField(...)
  ...
We try to use builders whereever possible in the code to make contributors used to it.

The tests are a good start. They should cover much more!
I searched for "kopp decker", which gives me following result:

The corresponding BibTeX is the following one:
``bibtex
@Article{journals/dke/DeckerKLW09,
title =	"Interacting services: From specification to
execution",
author =	"Gero Decker and Oliver Kopp and Frank Leymann and
Mathias Weske",
journal =	"Data Knowl. Eng",
year = 	"2009",
number =	"10",
volume =	"68",
bibdate =	"2019-06-02",
bibsource =	"DBLP,
http://dblp.uni-trier.de/https://doi.org/10.1016/j.datak.2009.04.003;
DBLP,
http://dblp.uni-trier.de/https://www.wikidata.org/entity/Q59898182;
DBLP,
http://dblp.uni-trier.de/db/journals/dke/dke68.html#DeckerKLW09",
pages =	"946--972",
}

I would expect, title, author, journal, year, number, volume and pages being present in the result. These are all requried fields for a `@article`.

Maybe, even all returend by the "BibTeX" result of CCSB could be shown here?
The fetcher should generate a BibTeX key. (I currently do not know how this works. Maybe the code of other fetchers can help? Think, its nested in doPostCleanup somehwere)

Multiple authors should be represnted in BibTeX format.
Tobias Olsson and Morgan Ericsson and Anna Wingkvist

We have an AuthorFormatter which can change the authors.
The other variant is to try to get the BibTeX directly from dblp.
If you stick with the dublin core parsing, please add an ADR for it. In case you switch to the BibTeX, an ADR cannot harm.

@@ -0,0 +1,6 @@
+@misc{,
+  author = {Tobias Olsson, Morgan Ericsson, Anna Wingkvist},

nodes.bodyText: Please let all files end with a new line

nodes.bodyText:
On the one hand, I think, the aim is to be careful when testing and be open to a new format. On the other hand, JabRef decided to test for the concrete format returned by the site. Seeing changes there very often, leads to an early attention of us (and not users showing up complaining that a fetcher does not work; refs #6369)
See https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/blob/master/src/test/java/org/jabref/logic/importer/fetcher/INSPIREFetcherTest.java for some examples.
Could you please add these kinds of tests, too?

commit.message: Make fetcher test more specific by checking each field explicitly

nodes.bodyText:
Would it be possible to remove \t\t  from the abstract?
Can we replace \r\n by the configured newline character (OS.NEWLINE)? --> Use org.jabref.logic.formatter.bibtexfields.NormalizeNewlinesFormatter in a CleanupJob.
org.jabref.logic.formatter.bibtexfields.TrimWhitespaceFormatter cannot be used for the first requriement. Think we need a new TrimWhitespaceAndFixNewLinesInTextFieldFormatter. Would it be possible for you to add such a Formatter?
Could you add a comment: "// Checking entries in the set as the query is generic and returns a changing result set"
Interesting. In CollectionOfComputerScienceBibliographiesFetcherTest.java, there was eng set as language. Where did the change come from? Does CCSB provide different languages?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="no"?>
+<?xml-stylesheet title="XSL_formatting" type="text/xsl" href="http://liinwww.ira.uka.de/bibliography/rss.xsl"?><rss version="2.0">
+    
+    <channel xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/">
+        
+        <title>CCSB: "test string which returns no results"</title>
+        <link>http://liinwww.ira.uka.de/bibliography/#search</link>
+        <description>Search results in The Collection of Computer Science Bibliographies for query: "test string which returns no results"</description>
+        <language>en</language>

nodes.bodyText:
Oh, wow, the 0001 and 0002 are generated by CCSB?
Would it be possible to remove [ ]\d+ at editors?
Excpected result:
Stefan Kolb and Christian Sturm

commit.message: Add three formatters to fix new lines in abstract and digits in editors

nodes.bodyText: Please remove the empty line

Oh, tabs are replaced by a space.
Maybe change the formatter name to ReplaceTabsBySpaceFormater and change the descriptoin accordingly.
Don't forget to add that string to JabRef_en.properties.
Could you please remove the empty line?

commit.message: Add localisation strings and renamed formatter

nodes.bodyText: Could we also use by instead of with? 😇  (consistency with class name)
See above 😇

Could you remove the . at the end? This would reduce load at our translators (as it is the same string as in the line above).
(Hope, I did not overlook something)
